moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 h6: this move, is what Bobby preferred: let's see, how this might unfold...
moves.8. Qb3: indeed Qb3, stands to reason: contesting f7; less impressive, is Nbd2, 0-0, a4, c5, Nb3...
moves.8... O-O 9. Nbd2: also part, of the original analysis; in some of the variations...
moves.9... Nd7: still, Bobby would have preferred this over Nc6; so does Fritz...
moves.10. a4: Black is threatening c5, in all variations: this looks like the safest way to go...
moves.10... c5 11. a5 Qc7 12. d5 Ng6 13. Qc2: already, White has to search for play; this was the best, Fritz could find...
moves.20. Nc6 fxe4 21. Qxe4 Bf5 22. Qe2 Nxc6 2: there is no telling, if Black will win this, in the end; but it seems to me, Bobby McGee and Fritz, that Bobby was quite right in 7. ... Ne7... I would say, the Kings Gambit is busted...

gameName: A bust to the Kings' Gambit? (final part)
players: Kings' Gambit  vs. Robert James Fischer
